sentences.sContent: While a ketch offers these advantages to cruisers, they may also be more expensive because of the added mast and sail.
sentences.sContent_eng: While a ketch offers these advantages to cruisers, they may also be more expensive because of the added mast and sail.
sentences.sCn: 尽管双桅帆给水手们提供了这些优势，它们也因为这额外的桅杆和船帆而造价更加昂贵。

sentences.sContent: She says the boat would be shaped like a capsule, powered by a small nuclear engine, and though there would be no sail, it would have a mast to hold a camera.
sentences.sContent_eng: She says the boat would be shaped like a capsule, powered by a small nuclear engine, and though there would be no sail, it would have a mast to hold a camera.
sentences.sCn: 斯托芬表示，探测船将被制成胶囊状，并由一个小型核动力引擎驱动，尽管不会有帆，但船上会有一个固定照相机的桅杆。

sentences.sContent: She has also studied everything from how to stitch her own wounds to how to cope with sleep deprivation and how to put out fires on board her 11.5-metre twin-mast ketch.
sentences.sContent_eng: She has also studied everything from how to stitch her own wounds to how to cope with sleep deprivation and how to put out fires on board her 11.5-metre twin-mast ketch.
sentences.sCn: 她还学习了相关知识，从如何缝合伤口，到如何应付睡眠不足的状况，再到如何扑灭高11.5米的双桅杆帆船上的火情，可谓应有尽有。

phrases.pCn: ◎在前桅的前部分，在艏；在艏楼

trans.tranOther: a tall pole on which the sails or flags on a ship are hung
to equip with a mast or masts
